summary: The 'End Domestic Terrorism Act' amends Title 18 of the United States Code to increase penalties for mass killings involving machineguns or covered semiautomatic weapons. It defines 'covered semiautomatic weapons' with specific criteria, mandates reports to Congress on charges filed under the new law and related material support charges, requires demographic data in wiretap reports, and requires the Department of Justice to publicly report on the impact and financial costs of such offenses. This bill aims to address gun violence and domestic terrorism.
